poem:
**The Warm-Up Act**

Pre-budget echoes in a chambered sky,  
Voices spar beneath an autumn's sigh.  
Rishi, with landscapes etched in mind,  
Claims the greatest earth, in whispers confined.  
Hoyle nods, Starmer debates,  
In scenery's folds, democracy waits.  
Characters carved where dreams repose,  
A budget unfolds as the brief speech slows.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Autumn budget live: Keir Starmer faces PMQs before Rachel Reeves delivers Labour’s budget 12.09pm GMT Rishi Sunak starts by thanking Hoyle and Starmer for his words. He says, as PM, he always liked the pre-budget PMQs, because he was just the warm-up act. He says he will be spending more time in the greatest place on earth, where the scenery is fantastic and the place is full of characters. He is talking about his consitutency". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
